intro: Discocalyx euphlebia, commonly known as the silverleaf euphlebia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which results from dense pubescence covering the leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Discocalyx euphlebia is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions.
